p: To date, FDA-licensed vaccines and antivirals are the most effective methods available to prevent and/or control influenza viral infections. However, influenza vaccines require at least 2 weeks after administration to induce protective immune responses against viral infection. In the case of antivirals, their effectiveness is dependent on being administered within 48 h after the appearance of symptoms [ 58, 59]. Importantly, antiviral-resistant strains have been described [ 1, 23, 24, 25]. Consequently, these prevention and treatment methods still leave substantial public health vulnerabilities.
